member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CaseInsensitiveComparison
member.summary: Case-insensitive operations (mostly comparison) on unicode strings.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CaseInsensitiveComparison.OneToOneUnicodeComparer
member.summary: This class seeks to perform one-to-one lowercase Unicode case mappings, which should be culture invariant.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CaseInsensitiveComparison.OneToOneUnicodeComparer.ToLower(System.Char)
member.summary: ToLower implements the one-to-one Unicode lowercase mapping as descriped in ftp://ftp.unicode.org/Public/UNIDATA/UnicodeData.txt. The VB spec states that these mappings are used for case-insensitive comparison
member.returns: If is upper case, then this returns its lower case equivalent. Otherwise, is returned unmodified.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CaseInsensitiveComparison.s_comparer
member.summary: Returns a StringComparer that compares strings according the VB identifier comparison rules.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CaseInsensitiveComparison.Comparer
member.summary: Returns a StringComparer that compares strings according the VB identifier comparison rules.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CaseInsensitiveComparison.Equals(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Determines if two VB identifiers are equal according to the VB identifier comparison rules.
member.returns: true if the identifiers should be considered the same.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CaseInsensitiveComparison.EndsWith(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Determines if the string 'value' end with string 'possibleEnd'.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CaseInsensitiveComparison.Compare(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Compares two VB identifiers according to the VB identifier comparison rules.
member.returns: -1 if < , 1 if > , 0 if they are equal.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CaseInsensitiveComparison.GetHashCode(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a case-insensitive hash code for VB identifiers.
member.param: identifier to get the hash code for
member.returns: The hash code for the given identifier

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CaseInsensitiveComparison.ToLower(System.String)
member.summary: Convert a string to lower case in culture invariant way

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CaseInsensitiveComparison.ToLower(System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: In-place convert string in StringBuilder to lower case in culture invariant way

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Collections.PooledStringBuilder
M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FailFast.Assert(System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Checks for the given ; if the is true, immediately terminates the process without running any pending finally blocks or finalizers and causes a crash dump to be collected (if the system is configured to do so). Otherwise, the process continues normally.
member.param: An optional message to be recorded in the dump in case of failure. Can be null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ErrorReporting.FatalError.Handler
member.summary: Set by the host to a fail fast trigger, if the host desires to crash the process on a fatal exception.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ErrorReporting.FatalError.NonFatalHandler
member.summary: Set by the host to a fail fast trigger, if the host desires to NOT crash the process on a non fatal exception.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ErrorReporting.FatalError.ReportUnlessCanceled(System.Exception)
member.summary: Use in an exception filter to report a fatal error. Unless the exception is it calls . The exception is passed through (the method returns false).
member.returns: False to avoid catching the exception.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ErrorReporting.FatalError.ReportWithoutCrashUnlessCanceled(System.Exception)
member.summary: Use in an exception filter to report a non fatal error. Unless the exception is it calls . The exception isn't passed through (the method returns true).

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ErrorReporting.FatalError.ReportUnlessNotImplemented(System.Exception)
member.summary: Use in an exception filter to report a fatal error. Unless the exception is it calls . The exception is passed through (the method returns false).
member.returns: False to avoid catching the exception.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ErrorReporting.FatalError.Report(System.Exception)
member.summary: Use in an exception filter to report a fatal error. Calls and passes the exception through (the method returns false).
member.returns: False to avoid catching the exception.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ErrorReporting.FatalError.ReportWithoutCrash(System.Exception)
member.summary: Use in an exception filter to report a non fatal error. Calls and doesn't pass the exception through (the method returns true).

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ObjectDisplayExtensions.IncludesOption(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ObjectDisplayOptions,Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ObjectDisplayOptions)
member.summary: Determines if a flag is set on the enum.
member.param: An enum field that specifies the flag.
member.returns: Whether the is set on the .

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ObjectDisplayOptions

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ObjectDisplayOptions.None
member.summary: Format object using default options.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ObjectDisplayOptions.IncludeCodePoints
member.summary: In C#, include the numeric code point before character literals.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ObjectDisplayOptions.IncludeTypeSuffix
member.summary: Whether or not to include type suffix for applicable integral literals.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ObjectDisplayOptions.UseHexadecimalNumbers
member.summary: Whether or not to display integral literals in hexadecimal.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ObjectDisplayOptions.UseQuotes
member.summary: Whether or not to quote character and string literals. In Visual Basic, this also enables pretty-listing of non-printable characters using ChrW function and vb* constants.

member.summary: The name of the method used to register a resumption delegate (see C# Specification, §7.7.7.1 Awaitable expressions).

members.member: The XmlCharType class is used for quick character type recognition which is optimized for the first 127 ascii characters.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.XmlCharType.InRange(System.Char,System.Char,System.Char)
member.summary: start >= value <= end

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ExpressionEvaluator.DebuggerTypeProxyExpansion
member.summary: Debugger type proxy expansion.
member.remarks: May include and as special cases. (The proxy is not declared by an attribute, but is known to debugger.)

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ExpressionEvaluator.Expansion
member.summary: The immediate children of a DkmEvaluationResult (e.g. the elements within an array). Ideally, the children are generated on demand, and not cached in the Expansion.
Get the rows within the given range. 'index' is advanced to the end of the range, or if 'visitAll' is true, 'index' is advanced to the end of the expansion.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ExpressionEvaluator.MemberExpansion
member.summary: Type member expansion.
member.remarks: Includes accesses to static members with instance receivers and accesses to instance members with dynamic receivers.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ExpressionEvaluator.MemberExpansion.NonPublicMembersExpansion
member.summary: An explicit user request to bypass "Just My Code" and display the inaccessible members of an instance of an imported type.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ExpressionEvaluator.MemberExpansion.StaticMembersExpansion
member.summary: A transition from an instance of a type to the type itself (for inspecting static members).

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ExpressionEvaluator.Formatter
member.summary: Computes string representations of instances.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ExpressionEvaluator.Formatter.GetTypeName(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Debugger.Metadata.Type,System.Boolean)
member.returns: The qualified name (i.e. including containing types and namespaces) of a named, pointer, or array type.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ExpressionEvaluator.Formatter.AppendQualifiedTypeName(System.Text.StringBuilder,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Debugger.Metadata.Type,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Append the qualified name (i.e. including containing types and namespaces) of a named, pointer, or array type to .
member.remarks: Keyword strings are appended for primitive types (e.g. "int" for "System.Int32"). Question mark syntax is used for . No special handling is required for anonymous types - they are expected to be emitted with set to "<Anonymous Type>. This is fortunate, since we don't have a good way to recognize them in metadata. Does not call itself (directly).

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ExpressionEvaluator.Formatter.AppendQualifiedTypeNameInternal(System.Text.StringBuilder,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Debugger.Metadata.Type,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Append the qualified name (i.e. including containing types and namespaces) of a named type (i.e. not a pointer or array type) to .
member.remarks: Keyword strings are appended for primitive types (e.g. "int" for "System.Int32").

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ExpressionEvaluator.Formatter.AppendNamespacePrefix(System.Text.StringBuilder,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Debugger.Metadata.Type,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Helper for appending the qualified name of the containing namespace of a type. NOTE: Unless the qualified name is empty, there will always be a trailing dot.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ExpressionEvaluator.Formatter.AppendUnqualifiedTypeName(System.Text.StringBuilder,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Debugger.Metadata.Type,System.Boolean,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Debugger.Metadata.Type[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Append the name of the type and its type arguments. Do not append the type's containing type or namespace.
member.param: Builder to which the name will be appended.
Type, the name of which will be appended.
True if identifiers that are also keywords should be prefixed with '@'.

The type arguments of the type passed to , which might be nested within . In the Reflection/LMR object model, all type arguments are passed to the most nested type. To get back to the C# model, we have to propagate them out to containing types.
The first position in that is a type argument to , from a C# perspective.
The number of type parameters of , from a C# perspective.
member.remarks: We're passing the full array plus bounds, rather than a tailored array, to avoid creating a lot of short-lived temporary arrays.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ExpressionEvaluator.Formatter.GetValueStringForCharacter(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Debugger.Evaluation.ClrCompilation.DkmClrValue,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Debugger.Evaluation.DkmInspectionContext,Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ObjectDisplayOptions)
member.summary: Gets the string representation of a character literal without including the numeric code point.

member.remarks: The corresponding native code is in EEUserStringBuilder::ErrTryAppendConstantEnum. The corresponding roslyn code is in . NOTE: no curlies for enum values.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ExpressionEvaluator.Formatter.ConvertEnumUnderlyingTypeToUInt64(System.Object,System.TypeCode)
member.summary: Convert a boxed primitive (generally of the backing type of an enum) into a ulong.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ExpressionEvaluator.EnumContextDataItem
member.summary:
This type exists to protect from spurious calls. We need to attach the same information to and
but they have different lifetimes. Enum contexts (which are effectively child lists) are closed before the corresponding evaluation results. We don't want to actually clean up until the evaluation result is closed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ExpressionEvaluator.EnumContextDataItem.#ctor(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ExpressionEvaluator.EvalResultDataItem)
member.remarks: Only is expected to instantiate this type.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ExpressionEvaluator.EvalResultDataItem
member.summary: A pair of DkmClrValue and Expansion, used to store state on a DkmEvaluationResult. Also computes the full name of the DkmClrValue.
member.remarks: The DkmClrValue is included here rather than directly on the Expansion so that the DkmClrValue is not kept alive by the Expansion.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ExpressionEvaluator.DeclarationInfo.None
member.summary: A declaration with this name has not been encountered.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ExpressionEvaluator.DeclarationInfo.FromDeclaredTypeOrBase
member.summary: This member is defined on the declared type or one of its base classes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ExpressionEvaluator.DeclarationInfo.FromSubTypeOfDeclaredType
member.summary: This member is defined on a type that inherits from the declared type (is more derived).

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ExpressionEvaluator.DeclarationInfo.HideNonPublic
member.summary: This member should be hidden (under "Non-Public members" node), because Just My Code is on and no symbols have been loaded for the declaring type's module.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ExpressionEvaluator.DeclarationInfo.IncludeTypeInMemberName
member.summary: More than one non-virtual member with this name exists in the type hierarchy. The ResultProvider should include the declaring type of this member in the member name to disambiguate.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ExpressionEvaluator.DeclarationInfo.RequiresExplicitCast
member.summary: The full name for this member access expression will require a cast to the declaring type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ExpressionEvaluator.MemberAndDeclarationInfo._inheritanceLevel
member.summary: Exists to correctly order fields with the same name from different types in the inheritance hierarchy.

member.summary: Data item to associate a computed raw string with a DkmClrValue.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ExpressionEvaluator.ResultProvider
member.summary: Computes expansion of instances.

member.name: T:Roslyn.Utilities.ObjectPool`1
member.summary:
Generic implementation of object pooling pattern with predefined pool size limit. The main purpose is that limited number of frequently used objects can be kept in the pool for further recycling.
Notes: 1) it is not the goal to keep all returned objects. Pool is not meant for storage. If there is no space in the pool, extra returned objects will be dropped.
2) it is implied that if object was obtained from a pool, the caller will return it back in a relatively short time. Keeping checked out objects for long durations is ok, but reduces usefulness of pooling. Just new up your own.
Not returning objects to the pool in not detrimental to the pool's work, but is a bad practice. Rationale: If there is no intent for reusing the object, do not use pool - just use "new".

member.name: T:Roslyn.Utilities.ObjectPool`1.Factory
member.remarks: Not using System.Func{T} because this file is linked into the (debugger) Formatter, which does not have that type (since it compiles against .NET 2.0).

member.name: M:Roslyn.Utilities.ObjectPool`1.Allocate
member.summary: Produces an instance.
member.remarks: Search strategy is a simple linear probing which is chosen for it cache-friendliness. Note that Free will try to store recycled objects close to the start thus statistically reducing how far we will typically search.

member.name: M:Roslyn.Utilities.ObjectPool`1.Free(`0)
member.summary: Returns objects to the pool.
member.remarks: Search strategy is a simple linear probing which is chosen for it cache-friendliness. Note that Free will try to store recycled objects close to the start thus statistically reducing how far we will typically search in Allocate.

member.name: M:Roslyn.Utilities.ObjectPool`1.ForgetTrackedObject(`0,`0)
member.summary:
Removes an object from leak tracking.
This is called when an object is returned to the pool. It may also be explicitly called if an object allocated from the pool is intentionally not being returned to the pool. This can be of use with pooled arrays if the consumer wants to return a larger array to the pool than was originally allocated.
